comments:
Build ID: Latest build

Steps To Reproduce:
1.Open OpenUP
2.Export the only config in OpenUP
3.Delete openup_basic plugin
4.Import the exported lib in Step 2, see serveral exceptions like this one:
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at java.io.File.<init>(File.java:194)
	at org.eclipse.epf.importing.services.ResourceScanner.processUrl(ResourceScanner.java:138)
	at org.eclipse.epf.importing.services.ResourceScanner.processUrl(ResourceScanner.java:98)
	at org.eclipse.epf.importing.services.ResourceScanner.scan(ResourceScanner.java:80)
	at org.eclipse.epf.importing.services.LibraryImportManager.scanResources(LibraryImportManager.java:917)
	at org.eclipse.epf.importing.services.LibraryImportManager.scanResources(LibraryImportManager.java:878)
	at org.eclipse.epf.importing.services.LibraryImportManager.scanResources(LibraryImportManager.java:897)
	at org.eclipse.epf.importing.services.LibraryImportManager.copyNewElementResources(LibraryImportManager.java:1314)
	at org.eclipse.epf.importing.services.LibraryImportManager.logNewElement(LibraryImportManager.java:1324)
	at org.eclipse.epf.importing.services.LibraryImportManager.setFeatureValue(LibraryImportManager.java:720)
	at org.eclipse.epf.importing.services.LibraryImportManager.doReplaceConfiguration(LibraryImportManager.java:467)
	at org.eclipse.epf.importing.services.LibraryImportManager.processDiffTree(LibraryImportManager.java:411)
	at org.eclipse.epf.importing.services.LibraryImportManager.processDiffTree(LibraryImportManager.java:437)
	at org.eclipse.epf.importing.services.LibraryImportManager.doMerge(LibraryImportManager.java:293)
	at org.eclipse.epf.importing.services.ConfigurationImportService.performImport(ConfigurationImportService.java:260)
	at org.eclipse.epf.importing.wizards.ImportConfigurationWizard$1.run(ImportConfigurationWizard.java:138)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)


More information:

This is a regression introduced two weeks ago due to resource path refactoring. All the method elements in the imported lib are detatched with their resources. However, the new resource path resolution relies on each element's resource to resolve its physical path. 

Fix needs to be made so that an imported method element should never get called on resolving its physical path before it is merged into the base library and saved with the new resource in the base library.

Fixed by removing 3 logNewElement calls where the imported new element has not
been merged and saved wiht the new resource in the base lib. These 3 calls
appears to be redundant, as the logNewElement call in doAdd should cover all
new elements. 

A note for reference: another more invloved approach would be to delay call
logNewElement for those elements at those 3 places.

A suggested senario for QA test:

1. Load a lib
2. Export the lib, or simply copy the lib to the export dir
3. Delete a plugin or a package or a cp, etc in the lib
4. Import the lib exported in Step 2.
5. Observe to see if there are any errors or exceptions, etc.
6. Try different deleted elements in Step 3 and repeat Steps 4, 5.
